meanings.sent1: When she gets anxious, she tends to hyperventilate.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to hyperventilate during exercise.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character started to hyperventilate comically after running in circles.
meanings.sent4: His excitement made him hyperventilate like a steam engine.
meanings.sent5: The scuba diver began to hyperventilate, causing bubbles to rise rapidly to the surface.

meanings.definition: To breathe in an abnormally rapid and deep manner
meanings.sent1: People may hyperventilate when they panic.
meanings.sent2: She had to calm down to stop hyperventilating.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed to hyperventilate with joy when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the trees hyperventilate, their leaves rustling loudly.
meanings.sent5: The hiker began to hyperventilate as he climbed higher up the mountain.
